channel.title: ATI 5850 drivers wont update
channel.description: I have a HIS ATI Radeon 5850 and the drivers have been stuck on 10.1 for quite some time now. It has something to do with some info in my registry (says ATI but won't offer any help). I've seen on a few sites people have had the same problem. I've tried putting in the data I need, followed all the steps correctly and it still reverts and has no effect. When I try to just install a newer version it unpacks it, I click install and it fails. I'm on Windows 7 64bit. Any ideas on what to do?

damn you and your max rep, this deserves points ++

item.title: ATI 5850 drivers wont update
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

uninstall your ATI drivers then use http://www.guru3d.com/category/driversweeper/ to remove the leftover crap, then try.

Read full topic

item.title: ATI 5850 drivers wont update
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:3, topic:347472”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=443850.msg3259140#msg3259140 date=1278365660]
Did you try uninstalling the old driver first? That’s what I’d try.
[/quote]
Yeah it fails as well.[/quote]

The uninstall fails? That can’t be good. Have you put in a support ticket of some sort with ATI perhaps?

Otherwise you could try removing it manually, remove every reference to ATI in the registry and all the .dlls (probably from safe mode, or a linux livecd). (actually try booting into safe mode and uninstalling it from there first)

Read full topic
